1.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

2.brief: to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)

3.brief: a male ass (from its dun red)
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)
a widow; also a desolate place

4.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

5.brief: a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
properly, to dawn, i.e. (figuratively) be (up) early at any task (with the implication of earnestness); by extension, to search for (with painstaking)
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food
a desert; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)

6.brief: to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

7.brief: to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

8.brief: a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
to clasp (the hands or in embrace)
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)

9.brief: to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
the breast of a woman or animal (as bulging)
to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)

10.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, a heap, i.e. a sheaf; also an omer, as a dry measure

11.brief: between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or
a trough (as dug out); specifically, a wine-vat (whether the lower one, into which the juice drains; or the upper, in which the grapes are crushed)
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)

12.brief: a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

13.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

14.brief: illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
properly, to dash in pieces, i.e. kill (a human being), especially to murder
properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) put to death
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

15.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to commit adultery; figuratively, to apostatize
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, a breeze, i.e. (by implication) dusk (when the evening breeze prevails)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

16.brief: to force a passage, as by burglary; figuratively, with oars
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to close up; especially to seal
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

17.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)

18.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)
properly, smoothness; figuratively, flattery; also an allotment
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

19.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

20.brief: to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
a maggot (as rapidly bred), literally or figuratively
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)

21.brief: to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
sterile (as if extirpated in the generative organs)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
a widow; also a desolate place
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right)

22.brief: to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

23.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, a place of refuge; abstract, safety, both the fact (security) and the feeling (trust); often (adverb with or without preposition) safely
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

24.brief: a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to tumble (in ruins); figuratively, to perish
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to draw together, i.e. close; by implication, to leap (by contracting the limbs); specifically, to die (from gathering up the feet)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a stream (as flowing); also an ear of grain (as growing out); by analogy, a branch

25.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
strictly a demonstrative particle, here; but used of time, now or then
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to lie (i.e. deceive), literally or figuratively
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
